name: Reversing Encryption
description:
A string 
    s
 of length 
    n
 can be encrypted by the following
algorithm: iterate over all divisors of 
    n
 in decreasing order (i.e. from

    n
 to 
    1
), for each divisor 
    d
, reverse the substring 
    s[1
    
    … d]
 (i.e. the substring which starts at position 
    1
 and ends at
position 
    d
). For example, the above algorithm applied to the string

    s
="codeforces" leads to the following changes: "codeforces" 
    →

"secrofedoc" 
    →
 "orcesfedoc" 
    →
 "rocesfedoc" 
    →

"rocesfedoc" (obviously, the last reverse operation doesn't change the string
because 
    d=1
). You are given the encrypted string 
    t
. Your task is
to decrypt this string, i.e., to find a string 
    s
 such that the above
algorithm results in string 
    t
. It can be proven that this string 
    s

always exists and is unique. Input The first line of input consists of a
single integer 
    n
 (
    1 
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 100
) — the length of the string

    t
. The second line of input consists of the string 
    t
. The length
of 
    t
 is 
    n
, and it consists only of lowercase Latin letters. Output
Print a string 
    s
 such that the above algorithm results in 
    t
.
Examples Input 10 rocesfedoc Output codeforces Input 16 plmaetwoxesisiht
Output thisisexampletwo Input 1 z Output z Note The first example is described
in the problem statement.
